en: SHAPE platform brings multiple showcases in April

Since it was born in December 2014, the Creative Europe-supported SHAPE platform for innovative music and audiovisual art has been working to popularize upcoming artists to adventurous audiences throughout Europe and beyond.
SHAPE platform brings multiple showcases in April
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)

Since it was established in December 2014, the Creative Europe-supported SHAPE platform for innovative music and audiovisual art has had as its goal to popularize idiosyncratic or upcoming artists to adventurous audiences throughout Europe and beyond.

During April, SHAPE will enter a mode of intense activity, organizing showcases in Sweden, Prague, Germany and Romania.

SHAPE platform started its new chain of activities on 9 April with a showcase at Prague venue MeetFactory. The project will visit more three music festivals across Europe.

Bucharest

SHAPE will visit Bucharest for the tenth anniversary of the Rokolectiv festival (23 – 26 April), bringing along the experimental French producer Mondkopf, Romanian-born DJ and producer Borusiade and eccentric sound artist Sillyconductor.

The showcase will be opened by Aisha Devi, who has previously worked under the moniker Kate Wax, but changed her artistic pseudonym to work in a way that allows exploring abstracted techno/club structures, yet at the same time drawing musical influences from her Tibetan and Nepalese heritage.

Malmö

The next stop for SHAPE will be Malmö’s Intonal festival (24 – 26 April), which is co-curated by SHAPE member festivals CTM and Unsound in collaboration with Swedish organization Inkonst.

The program of the event includes Marcus Schmickler or COH, the free-form rhythmic duo RSS B0YS, and Zamilska, whose take on contemporary techno was introduced by last year’s critically acclaimed album Untune.

Dresden

SHAPE will conclude its April marathon with a grand showcase at the ICAS Festival in Dresden (27 April – 3 May).

The SHAPE showcase of this event will feature contributions from nearly all of the platform’s participating festivals, thus taking on the form of a truly grand showcase. 17 SHAPE artists are featured in the program, including:

  • Hungarian digital composer Gábor Lázár
  • Italian rave music deconstructionist Lorenzo Senni
  • French producer of hypnotic rhythms Low Jack
  • English composer and violinist Kathy Alberici a.k.a. Bocca Al Lupo
  • Latvian extreme computer music author Martins Rokis with his rhythmically-oriented project N1L
  • Random Logic, pioneers of Slovene contemporary electronic music and ambient techno
  • Pasajera Oscura, a collaboration of female experimental musicians Chra and Irradiation

SHAPE

SHAPE stands for Sound, Heterogeneous Art and Performance in Europe and is a European music platform.

Each year, SHAPE’s union of 16 European adventurous music festivals and organizations creates a roster of 48 innovative musicians and audiovisual artists, and each festival showcases approximately nine of them throughout Europe and beyond.

SHAPE platform is supported by the Creative Europe Programme of the European Union.
